description:
godoc: always use local jQuery script

Fixes issue 5075.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

We used the googleapis one to benefit from caching (when online, the
dominant case). Has that decision changed?

I read the bug. Can we use local only for the offline case, and keep the
googleapis one for golang.org?

On 7 June 2013 10:41, David Symonds <dsymonds@golang.org> wrote:

> I read the bug. Can we use local only for the offline case, and keep the
> googleapis one for golang.org?
>

Yes. I'll rewrite the import as part of the deployment process for
golang.org.

Andrew

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=6d9d73e1f517 ***

godoc: always use local jQuery script

Fixes issue 5075.

R=golang-dev, dsymonds
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/10084044

subject: code review 10084044: godoc: always use local jQuery script
